Reviews.Title: “Not the luxury they portray, but passable.”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: Some creative photography makes these suites appear quite posh. The reality is a little less luxury, and rather spartan. The rooms were quite clean, and the heating worked well. No shortage of hot water for showers. Zero points for the view, if that's important to you. The Torre dell'Orologico is nowhere near this place, so if you're expecting a view out onto St. Mark's, you will be very disappointed. The one bit of service we found annoying was that they did not (and would not) provide an iron and ironing board in the room. You could send something out to be laundered, but I just needed some suits and shirts pressed, a nd they couldn't help me out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families, spacious, luxurious and central”
Reviews.Author: daveydave12
Reviews.Content: My wife, four boys and myself stayed here for 4 nights. The suite is acutally a very spacious, luxurious apartment within 30 second walking distance from St. Marco square. There is a kitchenette which is perfect for self-catering meals. Two very luxurious bathrooms. Two bedrooms and a large livingroom. The apartment is very well furnished and beautifully decorated. Very clean with daily housekeeping. Air conditioning worked very well. The close proximity to St. Marco makes it very easy to find the hotel--which is good because it is so easy to get lost in Venice. I really have nothing bad to say about this hotel. The staff were very nice and helpful. I recommend this place highly.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Anticipated!!!”
Reviews.Author: LaLuna215
Reviews.Content: The location off the Piazza San Marco cannot be beat, it is on a small quiet street but only a few steps away from all the action. The suite was beautifully appointed, spacious enough for 4 people, although one bathroom for 4 people may become an issue after a while (we only stayed one day, so we did not care). We had a 3rd floor unit (#134) with huge wooden beams across the ceilings, which were obviously not just decorative, in fact, we later saw our room from the canal, and our windows were just underneath a tiled roof. The A/C and TVs in our unit worked well, and we placed a wake up call with no problems. Everything in the bathroom worked properly, including a nice shower with hot water and plenty, if not too much, water pressure. The only annoying thing was the folding glass partition that would not stay open on the edge of the shower and kept folding on you while you were trying to shower. Be aware that the hotel does not have access for a water taxi, so you have to haul your luggage across Piazza San Marco, or pay a porter (30E for 4 large suitecases). The hotel receptionist was pleasant enough, and arranged for a porter for us and a taxi from Piazza San Marco to take us to the airport for 125E - pricey but worth it - it took 25 min to get to the airport ... same service with Ali Laguna was $60 for 4 people but would have taken 1 hour 20 min, and they are not exactly helpful with your luggage. The receptionist provided us with a key to the front door of the hotel which they lock after 8 or 9 pm, so we could get back in. Well, at 12 midnight, we could not for the life of us unlock that door! Another couple had their own key, but were unsuccessful as well. Thank G-d, their son was sleeping inside so they called him and he came downstairs and opened up for us. Bottom Line: Great Location, Great Amenities, Be Prepared to Pay Up to Your Ears for Everything While in Venice AND Lower Your Expectations! if the A/C in your room works, it's a miracle!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location but cold showers!”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveler60927
Reviews.Content: Very clean room and a little difficult to get around hotel but only major complaint is lack of hot water in evenings. After sweating all day in blazing heat a shower is a necessity. Only had hot water in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night before and 1 night after a Venice cruise. $350 per night. Nice suite first night. Lesser room second night in a different building. Would have been happier with a discouted price. Easy to find, Very close to San Marco Square. Clean, spacious. modern. Difficult and time consuming slog to the cruise terminal - but, possible. Great location if you intend to walk around shops and restaurants alot. Also close to Realto Bridge. Very Comfortable but, expensive. 3 euro for a bottle of water 12 oz.

Reviews.Title: “very nice, best location”
Reviews.Author: Luigi_Visit
Reviews.Content: just a few lines to say that the hotel is in the heart of the town, the best location. i have been in venice many times, always complaining about the rooms' size and their condition, usually very old. The rooms here are very large, and, at last... rooms in perfect shape. the staff is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location for Venice and at a great great price !”
Reviews.Author: arnop
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel that is well located (this one is amazingly well located) and not too expensive, well you've found it ! Torre dell'Orologio Suites offers only (it seems) suites and is located only a few yards from the amazing Piazza San Marco. From there, you'll be able to enjoy everything Venice has to offer. The suites are well appointed, comfortable and quiet. The only thing that turned us down is that from 7-8PM (ish...), the front desk closes and you WON'T be able to enter back in the hotel and then to you room ! The door is closed ! You first have to go to the next hotel down the street and ask the doormen to open the front door... I've never seen anything quite like this and it could have become a MAJOR issue. Thank god, after 10-15 mn ringing the bell, finally the night guard opened us the door. Another couple (with sleeping kids) was also in the street and waiting, believe me, management HAS to do something about this !

Reviews.Title: “Didn't plan to stay here but really enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: sooziedaisy
Reviews.Content: We found ourselves staying here because of the volcanic ash in April. En route from Australia to Glasgow, we had to make other arrangements after leaving Brisbane. My sister-in-law booked an apartment for us while we were on a train from Milan to Venice and we were very pleasantly surprised when we got here. It was a bit difficult to find as another reviewer said but well worth it. The rooms were lovely, decorated in a traditional Italian style and very comfortable. There was a small open plan kitchen which we didn't use but would have been fine for preparing a meal. We had breakfast in the adjoining hotel, a bit of a trek up and down different stairs but the breakfast itself was really good. Situated just off St Marks Square, the location was ideal for any sighteeing trips. We enjoyed our time there even though we weren't supposed to be there at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of "free" trip to Murano glass factories!!”
Reviews.Author: StarAU
Reviews.Content: Lovely decor, amenities and excellent location - just off San Marco Square. Nice continental breakfast. Beware of offer for "free" water taxi transportation to the Murano glass factories. It's only "free" going to the island - after the fact, you learn you have to find and pay for your return transportation!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at Torre dell'Orologio Suites”
Reviews.Author: SueScituate
Reviews.Content: Five of us (two adults, 3 teenage girls) stayed here for 3 nights in late September. The suite was HUGE and attractive. It was expensive but it was very centrally located by St. Mark's Sq. Breakfast was VERY good, quite a large choice of fruit, yogurt, pastries, cereal. Staff was helpful. Trip to Murano was included and we took it (unless you really want to splurge on expensive glass, I'd forgo it). I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Angelclo
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice before and always been really pleased but must say found this time a little disappointing, booked direct with hotel a Deluxe Suite the same as we have had before but on arrival I note we are actually in a Junior suite while still charged for a Deluxe, also there site does not allow you to enter number of children coming on trip just asks for the number of Adults so we assumed it would be as before that as long as you booked a room which had enough beds for the number in room would be ok, well apparently not and they charge 60 Eurossupplement per night for the child which when your staying for a longer break could be rather a lot of someones holiday budget! Breakfast used to be provided in the room of a self made variety which was simple but convenient if you did not want to rush out to breakfast each day but they now have it in the san marco palace restaurant which is pretty tricky to find so would recommend getting someone to actually physically show you where it is! One Flask of coffee was on the table which they periodically refill which meant every time we went down there one of us had to hand around for more coffee, rooms were adequately cleaned each day but quite often flannels etc were missing and we did not have a do not disturb sign which would have been handy due to the length of stay. on checkout due to an error they tried to overcharge us by 1100 Euros, nearly dropped from shock and was very relieved to have my paperwork on me stating the correct room rate

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Melbournechick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently with some family and had a fantastic time, the suites were beautiful and the staff made us feel very welcome. We did query why we could not have a iron in our room which they said was because of safety reasons, but they also could not iron our clothes for that evening until the next day! The location was amazing and it was very easy to find, a tour on a private water taxi to Murano island was included and we consider this a highlight. Venice is amazing and with our accomodation being so fantastic it is a great memory.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Bunty Bun
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Torre dell'Orologio Suites. There have been a few changes since the last reviews were written. Reception is now located a short walk from the suites, but is well directed and the breakfast is no longer self catering, but served at a nearby San Marco Hotel. We could not fault the accommodation. It was spotlessly clean, with daily changes of both towels and bed linen. The suites are extremely private and we only saw 2 other guests during are stay. The breakfast was a continental style buffet and was very good. The short walk was not a problem at all. Reception staff were always helpful and polite, even lending us umbrellas for the day when it rained! and a travel adapter. The suites we had on the second floor had two small balconies and it was lovely to hear the hustle and bustle of the people below going about there business, together with the chimes of the Torre dell'Orolgio! Highly recommended, would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Privacy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean, pleasant and polite reception staff. Liked being able to make our own breakfast at our chosen time. Good little, but perfectly adequate, kitchenette. Good clean furnishings. Only problem, how hard is it to give directions? i.e. through the clock tower second on left, if you reach small canal you've gone too far, we knew from previous visits roughly where it was, but took us 20 minutes to find. Situation ideal for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights after booking through lastminute. I thought it was excellent value for money with large, clean rooms (two bathrooms!) in a very central location (although a bit tricky to find at first). Wouldn't hesitate to recomend to anyone else travelling to venice who wants a central base. Pity the rest of the city wasn't such good value - 7 euros for a coke! 7!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was suppose to be the honeymoon we never had. Upon arrival we were informed that our rooms were given away and that we could only stay 2 nights. He upgrade our room. We were suppose to have a king bed and ended up with 2 double size beds. The 2 bathrooms were nice to have. If you want a hot shower, this isn't the place. Only a quarter of the way through the shower the water would start turning cold. By the end of the shower you were freezing. They had turned off the air condition so the only air you could get was to open the windows. Then you ended up with misquitos. I felt that it was overpriced for the hassels and heartache we had to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and Not for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in late March 2005 for several nights. Here are my quick thoughts: Very difficult to find, but that might be most hotels in Venice. It was not well marked and off a little alley. However, no one seem to know of the property either. Cleanliness: Overall the room was clean. However, the hide-a-bed was filthy and too dirty to use. Staff: Stefano was very helpful with the check in and made us feel welcomed. However, that's where it stopped. They were useless for finding info on trains, museum access or other information. The only restaurant they could recommend was their own some distance away. Room Layout: The suite we had had an upstairs room that was so warm, it was a sauna. I can't imagine what it would be like in later spring through summer. It would be unusable. As soon as you come into the room, you have stairs up and down. This would not be for everyone. We had to watch our youngest traveler closely because the floors are all hardwood and she slipped down the stairs twice. As we checked out, another couple was there with similar complaints so I'm hoping they listen. It's a great property but needs some work on staffing and signage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't believe there are know reviews on this property. I was a little hesitant to try this hotel since there was no feed back, but I took a chance. I'm sure glad I did!! The Location could't be better. Just under the clocktower and 2 short street on the left and your there. 1 minute walk to St. Marks Square. These are really more apartments than hotel rooms. We had a 1 bed room superior suite that had 2 wonderfully large bathrooms, one with a shower ( large) and the other with a tub/shower combination. There was a very nice living/dining room with a kitchenette which was more like a small kitchen, it had it's own room not part of the living room. The bedroom was a very nice size and the master bath was the one with with tub/shower. It was very hot when we were in Venice, the last week of June and the A/C was the best I've ever experienced in Venice. It was central A/C and we had complete control of how cold and how long we ran it. It sure felt good after coming in from a long hot/humid day. The staff could not be more helpful. We did have one small glitch when we got stuck in the elevator, but they were right on it and 15 munutes later we were saved!! Just another great story to tell!! The breakfast is basically a do it yourself affair. They provide yougurt, cereal, etc. in the refrigerator and you prepare it yourself. We never used the food supplies but chose to go to the market and buy our own Salami and Cheese, pasteries for our breakfast. Be sure to get there before 7PM as that is when the reception closes and you will have to go to the San Marcos Hotel to check in. This is not a big deal but if you came late you may think it is. Even though the reception desk is closed you can always reach someone at the desk at San Marco Hotel by phone from your room as in any hotel. What more can I say but you will not be disappointed in the Torre dell 'Orologio.

HotelInfo.Name: Torre dell'Orologio Suites
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 202A, 30124 Venice, Italy
